content.body: Can anybody help me understand this particular test case in URLPattern? https://github.com/whatwg/urlpattern/issues/240
Yagiz Nizipli: https://urlpattern.spec.whatwg.org/#canonicalize-a-pathname calls https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#url-path-serializer which adds `/` + `segment` for every segment
content.formatted_body: Yagiz Nizipli: https://urlpattern.spec.whatwg.org/#canonicalize-a-pathname calls https://url.spec.whatwg.org/#url-path-serializer which adds / + segment for every segment

content.body: Yagiz Nizipli: anything in particular unclear?
Canonicalize pathname adds `/-` if it starts with a leading slash is false. To avoid URL parser to add a `/` to the beginning https://urlpattern.spec.whatwg.org/#canonicalize-a-pathname
content.formatted_body: Canonicalize pathname adds /- if it starts with a leading slash is false. To avoid URL parser to add a / to the beginning https://urlpattern.spec.whatwg.org/#canonicalize-a-pathname

content.body: I think this is an inconsistency between URL parser and the URLPattern spec
so if I pass `/-./my-path` to canonicalize_pathname, it will return `./my-path`
content.formatted_body: so if I pass /-./my-path to canonicalize_pathname, it will return ./my-path

content.body: sorry. let me clarify: if I pass ./my-path to canonicalize pathname it will call url parser with /- prefix, and later canonicalize will return substr(2)
OK. I was trying to follow the spec by reading but I'm not the expert.
Yes, I implemented the spec 1 by 1, but this test is failing... https://github.com/ada-url/ada/pull/785
Yagiz Nizipli: I think you tagged the wrong Anne on the issue
content.formatted_body: Yagiz Nizipli: I think you tagged the wrong Anne on the issue
